title: 108_s25
content: DIVIDENDS OF INDIVIDUALS TAXED AT CAPITAL GAIN RATES. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include dividends taxed as net capital gain, which refers to dividends received from domestic corporations during the taxable year. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include dividends taxed as net capital gain, which refers to dividends received from domestic corporations during the taxable year. Dividends excluded from this definition include those from tax-exempt corporations under section 501 or 521, deductions under section 591, and dividends described in section 404(k). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include dividends taxed as net capital gain, excluding dividends from tax-exempt corporations. Qualified dividend income shall not include dividends on stock not meeting holding period requirements or amounts considered as investment income. Special rules apply for nonresident alien individuals. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include dividends taxed as net capital gain, excluding dividends from tax-exempt corporations. Qualified dividend income shall not include dividends on stock not meeting holding period requirements or amounts considered as investment income. Special rules apply for nonresident alien individuals in respect of amounts effectively connected with a trade or business within the United States and in determining the tax imposed for the taxable year. Treatment of dividends from regulated investment companies and real estate investment trusts is also addressed. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include dividends taxed as net capital gain, excluding dividends from tax-exempt corporations. Qualified dividend income is defined and special rules apply for nonresident alien individuals. Treatment of dividends from regulated investment companies and real estate investment trusts is also addressed. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include dividends taxed as net capital gain, excluding dividends from tax-exempt corporations. Qualified dividend income is defined, and special rules apply for nonresident alien individuals. Treatment of dividends from regulated investment companies is addressed, with rules on maximum tax rates. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include rules on gross income from sales or dispositions of stock or securities, distinguishing between short-term capital gain and long-term capital loss. Amendments are made to section 854(b)(1) and 854(b)(2) of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include rules on gross income from sales or dispositions of stock or securities. Section 854(b) is amended to adjust the maximum rate for tax purposes. Dividends received from real estate investment trusts are subject to restrictions under section 857(c). The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2002.
